meanings.sent1: Her inclinational nature led her to always choose the scenic route.
meanings.sent2: The inclinational behavior of the cat showed its preference for high places.
meanings.sent3: His inclinational love for ice cream often resulted in brain freeze.
meanings.sent4: The inclinational pull towards adventure tugged at her heart.
meanings.sent5: The inclinational decision to take risks defined his personality.

meanings.sent1: The inclinational signs pointed towards a storm approaching.
meanings.sent2: Her inclinational smile brightened up the room.
meanings.sent3: The inclinational habit of humming while working amused her colleagues.
meanings.sent4: The inclinational path of the river meandered through the valley.
meanings.sent5: His inclinational interest in astronomy sparked a lifelong passion.

meanings.definition: Having a natural inclination or tendency.
meanings.sent1: The inclinational talent for painting was evident from a young age.
meanings.sent2: The inclinational curiosity of the child led to endless questions.
meanings.sent3: His inclinational fear of spiders made him jump at the sight of a tiny one.
meanings.sent4: The inclinational growth of the plant towards the sunlight was fascinating to watch.
meanings.sent5: Her inclinational kindness towards animals made her a beloved volunteer at the shelter.
